title: Religious diversity in North America in 2010 , by religion
summary: This bar chart has 7 columns on the x axis representing Religion, and Percentage of population in each Religion on the y axis.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Christians and lowest at Religion Muslims.
The difference of Percentage of population between the highest and lowest Religion is 76.0.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of population for 7 number of Religions.
The Percentage of population is highest at Religion Christians and lowest at Religion Muslims.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 7 columns on the x axis representing Religion, and Percentage of population in each Religion on the y axis.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Christians and lowest at Religion Muslims.
The difference of Percentage of population between the highest and lowest Religion is 76.0.
max_summary: This bar chart has 7 columns on the x axis representing Religion, and Percentage of population in each Religion on the y axis.
Religion Christians has the highest Percentage of population and Muslims has the lowest Percentage of population.
Second maximum Percentage of population is found at Religion Unaffiliated.
The difference of Percentage of population between the highest and lowest Religion is 76.0.
Religion Christians is higher than any other Religions with value 77.0, followed by Unaffiliated, and Jews. Down to Religion Muslims with the lowest value 1.0.
Religion Muslims, Other religions, Hindus, and Buddhists have the same Percentage of population.
The Religion Muslims tends to be 5.39 percent lower than average.
The Percentage of population is 100.0 if we add up values of all Religions.
